By Penguin God on Tuesday, August 3, 2010 - 07:08 am:

Deffinitally let us know if you find a copy.

As of right now Amazon, gamestop, and Walmart.com have it listed as not available online.

Gamestop also lists it as not available in any stores.

Indeed it could be the situation where this is the ship day and stores will not have it until tomorrow, but yesterday gamestop had it listed as ships in 24 hours and now has it listed as unavailable online. It smells fishy to me, and saddly smells like an unexpected delay which I really REALLY hope is not the case.

Then again I'm going freaking nuts with Starcraft II, so if it get's delayed it won't be the end of the world.

By Serph on Wednesday, August 4, 2010 - 11:41 pm:

I've snooped around and found out the exact reason
why we don't have Monster Rancher DS at our
retailers.

Seems like UFO has a different way of releasing titles,
the release date was the 3rd, but instead that is the
date they ship out the product to stores, not the date
stores have it. Hence why
we keep getting odd dates.

By Penguin God on Thursday, August 5, 2010 - 06:24 am:

That is actually how it works with a majority of releases, except for big name titles. To be safe it's always best to assume that a game will come out the day after its "release".

Someone has shown proof of getting a copy on the Gamefaqs forums, and he lives in Ohio, so we may be seeing this today or tomorrow.
